paragraphs: The Christmas holidays are closer than it seems. Prague is already actively searching for the main Christmas tree of the country, and the organizers of the festive markets are forming lists of tenants and work schedules.
The first Prague Christmas market in 2025 will open at Náměstí Míru (Peace Square) near the metro station of the same name.
This will happen on Thursday, November 20, organizers reported.
The market will be open daily from 10:00 to 20:00 until Christmas Eve (December 24th).
The opening of all other holiday markets will take place gradually at the end of November and beginning of December.

The largest Christmas markets in Prague - on the Old Town and Wenceslas Squares - will open on Saturday, November 29th. Due to their central location and high demand from tourists, they will be open the longest - until January 6, 2026 inclusive.
